title: Add PowerPoint to PDF conversion feature

requirements.text: Add a new PowerPointToPdfPage component at frontend/src/pages/PowerPointToPdfPage.tsx that allows users to upload PowerPoint files (.ppt, .pptx) and convert them to PDF format with drag-and-drop file upload support, following the same UI patterns as ExcelToPdfPage and WordToPdfPage
acceptanceCriteria: Page accepts .ppt and .pptx file types for upload
Drag-and-drop file zone validates PowerPoint file types
Conversion progress tracking displays during processing
Successful conversion allows user to download the resulting PDF
Page requires authentication before allowing conversion
AdSense ad placements match the pattern used in other conversion pages

requirements.text: Create a utility function frontend/src/utils/powerPointToPdf.ts that converts PowerPoint files to PDF format, following the same structure and error handling patterns as excelToPdf.ts and wordToPdf.ts, with progress callback support
acceptanceCriteria: Function accepts PowerPoint file blobs as input
Function validates file type is .ppt or .pptx
Function provides progress callback for UI updates
Function returns a PDF blob on successful conversion
Function throws descriptive errors for invalid inputs or conversion failures

requirements.text: Add a PowerPoint to PDF card to the ConvertIntoPdfPage grid at frontend/src/pages/ConvertIntoPdfPage.tsx that links to the new PowerPoint conversion page, positioned after the Excel to PDF card and following the same styling pattern
acceptanceCriteria: Card displays appropriate icon and title for PowerPoint to PDF
Card links to /tools/powerpoint-to-pdf route
Card styling matches existing Word and Excel conversion cards
Card is positioned logically in the grid layout

requirements.text: Add routing configuration for the PowerPoint to PDF page in frontend/src/App.tsx, creating a new route at /tools/powerpoint-to-pdf that lazy-loads PowerPointToPdfPage, following the same pattern as other tool routes
acceptanceCriteria: Route /tools/powerpoint-to-pdf is registered in the router configuration
Route lazy-loads the PowerPointToPdfPage component
Route follows the same authentication and layout patterns as other tool pages

requirements.text: Add internationalization keys for PowerPoint to PDF feature in frontend/src/i18n/translations.ts, including page titles, upload instructions, button labels, and error messages in both English and Spanish, following the naming pattern used for other conversion tools
acceptanceCriteria: English translations added for all PowerPoint to PDF UI text
Spanish translations added for all PowerPoint to PDF UI text
Translation keys follow the established naming convention (e.g., tools.powerPointToPdf.*)
All user-facing text in PowerPointToPdfPage uses i18n hooks

requirements.text: Add a PowerPoint to PDF link to the homepage tool grid at frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx, positioned logically among other conversion tools with appropriate icon and description
acceptanceCriteria: Link card appears on the homepage tool grid
Card includes PowerPoint-related icon
Card description clearly indicates PowerPoint to PDF conversion
Card navigates to /tools/powerpoint-to-pdf when clicked

constraints: Do not modify immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui/*
Follow the single-actor backend architecture pattern without creating additional actors
Use only frontend-based conversion; do not add backend PowerPoint processing logic
Maintain consistency with existing conversion page patterns (Word, Excel, Image to PDF)
Use the same AdSense placement strategy as other conversion pages
nonGoals: Backend PowerPoint file storage or processing
Server-side PowerPoint conversion logic in Motoko
Advanced PowerPoint features like animations, transitions, or embedded media
Batch PowerPoint conversion (multiple files at once)
